t0.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 180 days from today.

t1.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 7 days after t0.

timespan.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 7 days.

band.description: Filter results by band (either '2.4', '5' or '6'). Note that data prior to February 2020 will not have band information.

perPage.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000.

startingAfter.description: A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

endingBefore.description: A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

sortOrder.description: Sorted order of entries. Order options are 'ascending' and 'descending'. Default is 'ascending'.

t0.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.

t1.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

timespan.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.

types.description: A list of event types to include. If not specified, events of all types will be returned. Valid types are 'assoc', 'disassoc', 'auth', 'deauth', 'dns', 'dhcp', 'roam', 'connection' and/or 'sticky'.

band.description: Filter results by band. Valid bands are '2.4', '5' or '6'.

ssidNumber.description: Filter results by SSID. If not specified, events for all SSIDs will be returned.

includedSeverities.description: A list of severities to include. If not specified, events of all severities will be returned. Valid severities are 'good', 'info', 'warn' and/or 'bad'.

deviceSerial.description: Filter results by an AP's serial number.

tags.description: An optional parameter to filter networks by tags. The filtering is case-sensitive. If tags are included, 'tagsFilterType' should also be included (see below).

productTypes.description: An optional parameter to filter networks by product type. Results will have at least one of the included product types.

endingBefore.description: A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

t0.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 365 days and 6 hours from today.

t1.description: The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 7 days after t0.

timespan.description: The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 7 days. The default is 2 hours.

networkIds.description: Optional parameter to filter readings by network.

serials.description: Optional parameter to filter readings by sensor.

metrics.description: Types of sensor readings to retrieve. If no metrics are supplied, all available types of readings will be retrieved. Allowed values are apparentPower, battery, button, co2, current, door, downstreamPower, frequency, humidity, indoorAirQuality, noise, pm25, powerFactor, realPower, remoteLockoutSwitch, temperature, tvoc, voltage, and water.

models.description: Optional parameter to filter RF profiles by one or more device models. All returned devices will have a model that is an exact match.
